name: Floyd the Barber
wikiSummary: A claustrophobic, desperate dirge about "a small town gone bad", Floyd was Cobain's comment on his upbringing in Aberdeen, Washington and the feelings of emasculation that came from living with his macho dad.    The song took its title from a character in 60s US sitcom The Andy Griffith Show.
wikiText:
A claustrophobic, desperate dirge about "a small town gone bad", Floyd was Cobain's comment on his upbringing in Aberdeen, Washington and the feelings of emasculation that came from living with his macho dad.  
 
 The song took its title from a character in 60s US sitcom The Andy Griffith Show.
